name: places/ChIJj92eGsRYwokRvk8rMKHfZMU
formattedAddress: 535 E 70th St, New York, NY 10021, USA
adrFormatAddress: 535 E 70th St, New York, NY 10021, USA

originalText.text:
Hands down the WORST physical therapy place, with the worst employees, I've been to, (and I've been to many in my life.)
The entire place is an incredible sh-t show.
No one knows who's supposed to make your appointments after the first one and you will end up with gaps early on because of this lack of protocol and lack of actually monitoring the patients.
I was first given a physical therapist who showed up 15 minutes late and cut out 10 minutes early so the appointment was less than half the time scheduled for the evaluation. She also was unable to use basic technology.
I was told to contact the office manager. The people on the phone lie to you telling you this person is going to call you back (even specifying when) but she never will and it will take you 5 days of trying to reach her till you finally get her on the line after being hung up on another three times.
They gave me a different therapist named Kassandra aka Kassi who was just plain obnoxious mean and nasty. Apparently she resented having to take an early evening slot. She had a terrible attitude, and was hostile about any physical therapy questions. She started out by showing a negative attitude for my chronic illness, talking derogatorily about it and showed she clearly didn't understand what it actually is (she expressed very wrong ideas about it from about two decades ago, before more scientific research clarified it).
She literally withheld all possible important information (even when asked)–refusing to provide information about how to do the exercises properly, how and when to use things like ice, etc. She was passive aggressive to the max. She wanted me to do something which I am physically unable to do and which my specialist has told me to *never* even think about doing because it would massively exacerbate my chronic illness, so when I told her all that, she kept arguing with me and ignoring what I was saying, then she obnoxiously an absurdly wrote into my chart notes which are visible in the hss app that I "refused" to do it. She wrote a lot of false statements into the chart. She was stressing me out by massively hurrying me because they have some agenda to hurry patients through really fast, not at all concerned about doing the wrong thing for the patient, and she kept lying about how many appointments I was going to have and continuously whittling it down to so few I wasn't even given the complete program. She didn't do the normal and safe thing, which would be to have a human being progress at their own rate, and only decide how many appointments after progress has actually been monitored. Nothing was monitored or appropriate.
She gave me instruction sheets with all wrong information about what exercises I should do at home, and indicated she couldn't be bothered when I asked her to provide accurate ones (she then wrote a misspelled word or two onto the inaccurate ones and still did not correct the fact that they were inaccurate sheets).
The place claims to have sessions available even as "late" as 6:30 p.m. and schedulers will initially book you for those, but the physical therapists are always wanting to cut out early and they'll purposely not even give you the entire exercise program just so they can get rid of anyone scheduling after 5:00 p.m..
Literally EVERYONE at this facility lies and lies and lies, and lies about the lies. Everyone from the phone answering people, to the physical therapists, to the PT supervisors, to the useless office manager. The supervisors and office manager make themselves completely inaccessible. The whole place is a giant mess, the physical therapy is bad, and no one has a healing attitude towards patients.
I can't believe these people at HSS are getting insurance money for their extremely uncaring, remiss, dangerous and unprofessional "services" when I could get something safer and better from even a YouTube video from a non-physical therapist, without the nasty attitude and the extremely dangerous mad hurry and  unnecessary pain they inflict on patients, ultimately doing more harm than anything.

originalText.text: Shaun was great post-surgery.  Virtual therapy was great!

text.text: Shaun was great post-surgery.  Virtual therapy was great!

originalText.text:
My Opinion:  PROFIT OVER PATIENT CARE.
They're getting by on their reputation from years ago and with fabulous TV ads that Madison Avenue advertising agencies put together.  I'm sure many of the Drs are very good. However, the Physical Therapy department couldn't be worse. Yes of course some of the therapists may be good; however the physical therapy department is run like a restaurant. The  physical therapy department, simply put, can not get in enough patients to bill their insurance. 1/2 hour appts & that is it & that includes taking your coat off & getting yourself situated. No ice or heat given or asked if the patient wants it. Get the patients In & out as quickly as possible & bill their insurance is all they are interested in, period. This place is run like a mill.  They will drop you as  a patient in a heartbeat if you cancel more than they feel is acceptable. Inclement weather? Nope, not an excuse even for people who shouldn't be traveling or walking in slippery weather. No, drop them  & replace with patients that won't leave an empty  *unbillable* 1/2 hour slot on their calendar. As I said, get those patients in & out and bill, Bill & BILL their insurance. Bottom Line folks, $$$$$ - definitely not what's in the patients best interest. Look elsewhere! Again, my opinion.

originalText.text: Shaun's awesome very knowledgeable, ontime never have  I experienced any negative a this loca. My Therapist for my wrist he is amazing.

originalText.text: My PHysical Therapist here is Will. He goes above and beyond to help me get back on my feet. He keeps me motivated, and he has a wonderful personality. He gives me a lot of guidance, making sure I figure it out so I accomplish all I can to get better. It’s a long journey, but I’m happy to have Will assisting me back to a normal way of life.
